content:
About the project The main goal of this project is to detect the infected Malaria cells among the images of the parasitized and uninfected cells.
Methodology   Data: The dataset is acquired from Kaggle dataset a total of 27,558 cell images with equal instances of parasitized and uninfected cells, which are segmented cells from the thin blood smear slide images from the Malaria Screener research activity.
  Metadata: The images are stored in two folders labelled as infected and uninfected. Each of images is in RGB format and has size of 142 × 163 pixels.
  Since the dataset contains a set of image data and the project is a classification problem, I consider that convolution neural network(CNN) is the most reasonable and appropriate approach for this project. Also, it is because CNNs work well with data that has a spatial relationship.
  Metrics: Tuned and evaluated models through computing the accuracy, presented by confusion matrix and accuracy score on the test set.
  Result summary  Baseline model:  94.4% accuracy on the test set Precision = 0.9408122833085686 Recall = 0.9200775006054734     Regularized model:  95.8% accuracy on the test set Precision = 0.9501204819277108 Recall = 0.9661847586375888     Model using Keras:  95.27% accuracy on the test set Precision = 0.925703737886479 Recall = 0.9830923793187945    Further Details For more information, check out:
